sort of.translation[0].definitions[0].de: used to say that something is partly true but does not describe the exact situation
sort of.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I sort of like him, but I don’t know why.
‘Do you know what I mean?’ ‘Sort of.’
sort of.translation[0].definitions[1].de: used when you are trying to describe something but it is difficult to find the right word or to be exact
sort of.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Then they started sort of chanting.
The walls are a sort of greeny-blue colour.
It was sort of like really strange and mysterious, walking round this empty building.
sort of.translation[0].definitions[2].de: used to make what you are saying sound less strong or direct
sort of.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Well, I sort of thought we could go out together sometime.
It was sort of a shock when I found out.
sort of.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a price etc that is not very exact, but could be slightly more or less
sort of.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: That’s the sort of price I was hoping to pay.
What sort of time were you thinking of starting?
